meanings.definition: A feeling of smug or uncritical satisfaction with oneself or one's achievements.
meanings.sent1: His complacencies about his success made him blind to his shortcomings.
meanings.sent2: She basked in the complacencies of her accomplishments, unaware of the challenges ahead.
meanings.sent3: The cat's complacencies after catching the mouse were amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The complacencies of the wealthy can sometimes lead to their downfall.
meanings.sent5: The complacencies of the student were shattered when he failed the exam.

meanings.definition: A feeling of quiet pleasure or security, often while unaware of some potential danger or defect.
meanings.sent1: The old man enjoyed the complacencies of sitting by the fireplace on a cold evening.
meanings.sent2: She found complacencies in the familiar surroundings of her childhood home.
meanings.sent3: The complacencies of the hiker who wandered off the trail led to an unexpected adventure.
meanings.sent4: The complacencies of the town were disrupted by the sudden arrival of a circus.
meanings.sent5: The complacencies of the dog lying in the sun were interrupted by a passing squirrel.
